{\pntxta )}}{\*\pnseclvl8\pnlcltr\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang{\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}{\*\pnseclvl9\pnlcrm\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang{\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}\pard\plain \s1\ql \li0\ri0\keepn\nowidctlpar\faauto\outlinelevel0\rin0\lin0\itap0 

\b\fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par Facility:\tab Roemerman Feed & Grain

\

par Contact:\tab Bruce Klyn

\par Phone:\tab 641-938-2912

\par }{\b\fs20 

\par {\pntext\pard\plain\b\fs20 \hich\af0\dbch\af0\loch\f0 1.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-720\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\tx720{\*\pn \pnlvlbody\ilvl0\ls1\pnrnot0\pndec\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang{\pntxta .}}\faauto\ls1\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\b\fs20 Facility Policy.

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl12\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\faauto\ilvl12\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl12\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\faauto\ilvl12\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 The owners, management and employees of Roemerman Feed & Grain (the facility) are committed to the prevention}{\b\fs20  }{\fs20 

of any accidental releases of}{\b\fs20  }{\fs20 anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with

 the local fire department, or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.  

\par }{\b\fs20 

\par {\pntext\pard\plain\b\fs20 \hich\af0\dbch\af0\loch\f0 2.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-720\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\tx720{\*\pn \pnlvlbody\ilvl0\ls1\pnrnot0\pndec\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang{\pntxta .}}\faauto\ls1\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\b\fs20 Facility Information.

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 The primary activity at the facility is the storage of  fertilizers for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for 

direct application  for crop production nutrients.The maximum quantity stored would be approximately 156,060 pounds in 1 \endash  12,000 gallon storage tank and 24 \endash  1,000 gallon nurse tanks.

\par }\pard\plain \s2\ql \li720\ri0\keepn\nowidctlpar\faauto\outlinelevel1\rin0\lin720\itap0 \b\fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cg

rid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\b\fs20 3.\tab Worst-Case Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario

\par }{\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \s15\ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin1440\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 a.\tab 

The worst-case scenario would be the release of the total contents of a storage tank released as gas over a period of 10 minutes.  The maximum quantity released would be 52,020 pounds, which represents the volume of the largest storage tank 

(12,000 gallons) at 85 percent capacity as limited by design standards.  The distance to the end point (point of dispersion to 200 parts per million, or ppm) is about 1.8  miles.  

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \s15\ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin1440\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 b.\tab 

The alternate release scenario, based on the five-year accident history (or the most likely potential incident), is a release from a break in a 3-inch transfer hose followed by release of ammonia for 2 minutes before an automatic or manual shut-off interv

enes and stops the flow of ammonia.  The maximum quantity released would be 26,640 pounds.  The distance to the endpoint (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 1.20 miles.  

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\b\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 4.\tab Accidental Release Prevention Program

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 The facility has been reviewed for general compliance with the provisions of \'93Safety Requirements for the Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1\'94

, published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. (ANSI), and the standards of the U.S.

Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, \'93Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia\'94

.  The ANSI Standard has been adopted by reference by Iowa Administrative Code Part 21\endash Chapter 43\endash Rule 43.6(200)-Standard for the storage and  handling of anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA 

standard is referenced in the Registration Form Section 8.3.b.

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 5.\tab Five-Year Accident History.\tab \tab 

\par }{\fs20 

\par }\pard\plain \s16\ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at th

e facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.  

\par }\pard\plain \ql \fi720\li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 \fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 6.\tab Emergency Response Program.

\par }{\fs20 

\par \tab The facility has:

\par 

\par \tab a.\tab a written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38; and

\par 

\par }\pard \ql \fi-720\li1440\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin1440\itap0 {\fs20 b.\tab provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \fi720\li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\b\fs20 7.\tab Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

\par }{\fs20 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\nowidctlpar\faauto\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs20 Safety improvement is an on-going process at
